title: Verified Purchase
content: Wow‚Ä¶ what a completely epic and powerful story this book was! This is a book that is subtle in its brilliance, it‚Äôs one of those books that gets even better the more you sit and think about it. I‚Äôm still kind of in awe as I sit here and reflect back on the sheer magnitude of everything that happened over the course of this book. This isn‚Äôt the type of book I typically read but I‚Äôve heard so many people talking about it and with nearly 14,000 5-star reviews, how could I not check it out? I‚Äôm very glad I did because it was such a moving experience and it really makes you reflect on your own life and certainly will make you thankful for the freedoms we enjoy each day. It wasn‚Äôt over the top or gratuitous but it was a very real and honest portrait of life for women in France during WWII and the journey of two sisters as they set out on two very different paths towards survival and freedom in this horrific era.
post_time: Reviewed in the United States on October 5, 2024

title: A Literary Masterpiece Transformed Into A Heartbreaking Yet Empowering Movie For The Mind‚Äôs Eye
content: The story centers around two sisters, Vianne Mauriac and Isabelle Rossingol. Vianne, the older and more responsible of the two is living a peaceful and happy life with her husband and daughter in the French countryside. At the threat of impending war, her life is upended when her husband, Antoine, is sent off the fight for France. As Germany begins to occupy France, Vianne is forced to learn how to survive in these new times and protect her young daughter, Sophie. Meanwhile, Isabelle, the younger more rebellious sister has spent much of her childhood being bounced from one boarding school to the next. After the death of their mother when she was just 4, Isabelle has been largely abandoned by her sister and their father. Neither one knowing how to handle the rambunctious girl. As the war starts, Isabelle is not content to sit back and watch as her beloved city of Paris is overtaken by the enemy. Longing to make a difference in the war, Isabelle makes some shocking choices that will forever alter the trajectory of her life.

title: Verified Purchase
content: Vianne and Isabelle‚Äôs war-time experience was vastly different, but I was fascinated and inspired by each. Their situations and choices, combined with their tumultuous history, was the source of much conflict between the two. But I loved that when push came to shove, they were still sisters and that‚Äôs a bond that is pretty hard to break. I loved seeing how their paths would intersect over the course of the book, even when it was heartbreaking. As I read, I found myself waiting for the time when they would cross paths again. Their relationship was so complicated and well written, I was 100% invested in each of their journeys as well as the evolution of their relationship with each other.

title: Phenomenal book, engaging story line
content: I found myself relating with Vianne on many levels. I can‚Äôt imagine having to live what she lived through, but I could picture myself making some of the same decisions she did. She was cautious and was one to try to fly under the radar in order to not draw attention to herself or her daughter. She did what she had to in order to survive but she wasn‚Äôt one to take unnecessary risks. There were few exceptions to this rule as time goes on, however, and I was so proud of some of the things she was able to do. Of course my heart also broke time and again for the things she had to endure or do. She was certainly a hero in her own right for the part she played in the war, and I think she deserved just as much recognition as her sister. And both of them deserved as much recognition as the men on the front lines. I was fascinated by all of the complicated relationship dynamics at play with her and the various men in her life, from Antoine, to Beck to her father and Von Richter. It was all so well done, I know I‚Äôm not doing any of it justice here!
post_time: Reviewed in the United States on October 8, 2024

title: I really enjoyed this book!
content: The Nightingale by Kristin Hannah: I really enjoyed this book. The story is based in Occupied France during World War 2. It had great Character development, watching both Isabelle and Vianne grow into courageous women. While the men are away at war, the women and children left behind become mentally strong and resilient. They learn how to survive and defy the Germans. I appreciated the theme of forgiveness throughout the book. The author did a fantastic job showing how the line of right and wrong needs to be blurred for the ‚Äúgreater good.‚Äù I do wish the ending had more end of war details as it felt a little rushed, however I still give the book a 10/10.

title: Verified Purchase
content: This book is about 2 sisters who lived in France during WWII during the German occupation.  The story of one of the sisters loosely follows the true story of the young Belgian girl, Monique Hanotte, who risked her life to help escort 135 Allied airman out of German occupied France and Belgium.  It was difficult to put down the book; I kept wondering what would be the fate of the 2 sisters and their families.  I was unaware that the French were treated so badly by the Germans - the Germans imposed near starvation upon the French.  The actions of the Germans are a reminder of how easy it is for ordinary decent people to slip into depravity.  I didn't rate it 5 stars because, even though it is a compelling story, I did not think the writing had the artistic depth of say a John Steinbeck.  It is still well worth the read.
post_time: Reviewed in the United States on July 14, 2024

content: Found my eyes filling with tears at several points throughout this book. There are a lot of parallels between the Nazis and today‚Äôs modern leftist Democrat party. What I did find a bit odd was the author‚Äôs choice with Isabelle. She was talking about a ‚ÄúFree France‚Äù and prosperity yet she joined up with Communists‚Ä¶There is no freedom or prosperity with Communism (quite the opposite). Socialism and Communism combined has killed well over 100 million people. Again, I found that to be a rather odd character choice. Otherwise I enjoyed this.

post_time: Reviewed in the United States on August 25, 2024

title: Verified Purchase
content: I had to take a bit of a break from this, was feeling very burnt out on WWII books and this was dragging a bit for me. Once I made to to around 50% it really picked up for me. The characters were so though to like at the beginning but I really warmed up to them. Kristin Hannah books always make me cry and this was no different. The themes of doing anything for your family really got me.
post_time: Reviewed in the United States on June 27, 2024
